features: Eco-Friendly : Make an environmentally responsible choice with sustainable bamboo.
Soft & Durable 3-Ply : Ensures comfort and everyday durability for a luxurious feel.
Hypoallergenic Comfort: Gentle on skin, perfect for sensitive users seeking a soothing touch.
Biodegradable & FSC Certified: Biodegradable bath tissues that minimize environmental impact for responsible living.
Cost-Effective Longevity: Get 12 mega rolls for extended use, reducing the need for frequent replacements.
Bamboo Bliss Luxury: Experience the indulgence of Bamboo comfortable touch and superior absorbency for a mess-free experience.
Compostable Convenience: Easily breaks down, contributing to eco-friendliness with responsibly sourced materials
FSC Certified Sustainability: Make a green choice, with FSC Certification for Sustainable Sourcing.
Septic-Safe Assurance: Designed to be septic-safe, providing peace of mind for both plumbing and the environment.
Why EcoSoul: Our priority, Ecosoul is committed to deliver high-quality products to our customers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Switch to bamboo NOW
reviews.reviewText: Bamboo is such a versatile plant … I have clothing … sheets … kitchen bowls / containers… and now TOILET PAPER. It is superior to paper in that it doesn’t leave gross residue. It is strong yet soft and I love that it is individually wrapped (bamboo wrapping) so I can leave a spare roll out when having guests and it doesn’t look tacky or get dusty.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sustainable choice, great value
reviews.reviewText: I recently made the switch to eco-friendly bamboo toilet paper, and I couldn't be happier with my decision. Not only does it feel just as soft and comfortable as traditional toilet paper, but knowing that it's better for the environment makes every use feel guilt-free.Considering the rapid rate at which trees are being cut down for paper production, using bamboo, a fast-growing and sustainable resource, feels like a small step towards preserving our forests. Plus, bamboo requires less water and fewer pesticides to grow, making it a more planet-friendly choice.At first, I was concerned about the quality, thinking that eco-friendly options might compromise comfort, but I was pleasantly surprised. It's heartening to know that my purchase is contributing to a greener planet.In conclusion, making the switch to eco-friendly bamboo toilet paper has been a win-win for me. It's as comfortable and effective as traditional options while being much kinder to the environment. I highly recommend giving it a try – your bum and the planet will thank you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars VERY soft, good TP
reviews.reviewText: I bought these to try out bamboo and because I've been disatisfied with the quality of TP at local stores for the most part.I didn't realize this was 3-ply, which probably isn't necessary. The product feels incredibly smooth and isn't "dusty" or already falling apart like I've experienced with big brand TP.My main girpe with this product, which seems obvious for a brand trying for "eco-friendliness" is there is additional paper waste, each roll being invidually wrapped, plus the chemical dyes used. The wrapping paper is decent quality paper, and could be used for crafts, but I don't personally have time for that. Put 3 into a long unbleached/brown paper bag with a simple plant based ink/branding and I'd be happier.I'm going to try another brand, and if it's significantly worse then I'll go back to this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Likely the best t-paper
reviews.reviewText: This tp does not disintegrate, is firm enough, and reasonably soft, and the wrappers are fun. I can shred and compost the wrapper and carton.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The rolls are smaller than expected.
reviews.reviewText: Because I live in an RV I need septic safe TP and wanted to try something different from the 1ply 1000 sheet rolls over been using.The product itself is fine, no real complaints. Sustainable product wrapped in recyclable paper, you can't really go wrong.However the price point for less product is a hard sell for me. As a single person I go through a roll in about a week and a half even though I'm pulling less of the roll, where the other stuff lasts a month. I don't know if I'll buy again, but I have nothing negative to say about the quality of the product itself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not thick enough
reviews.reviewText: I don’t want a bleached product. I’m used to a bamboo paper that is sturdier on. The wrapping is pretty but is another thing I have to deal with. I like the more natural products, they’re soft and less chemicals in a delicate area. Rosie B.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Soft and you don't know it's different than regular toilet paper
reviews.reviewText: It's soft, it's three ply, I like how recyclable even the wrapping paper feels and the core roll. Definitely feels better than traditional toilet paper at the homes I visit or in public

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Would be great if it wasn't bleached
reviews.reviewText: It's a shame they choose to bleach this tissue. No, it's not chlorine, but it IS bleached. This wastes resources and puts unnecessary chemicals on your most sensitive skin. Otherwise, it is awesome tissue. Priced very competitive, nice and soft, and big, long lasting rolls. PLEASE, start caring enough about the planet to stop wasting precious resources (so much more water!) just so someone can wipe their rear with white paper! Anyone who truly cares prefers it natural!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love the softness yet strength of this toilet paper. I also love how the start of the roll is not glued down so much you waste alot of paper to get your first sheet.I love how it rips at the perforations with ease and is made using bamboo fibre. Next step hemp paper ?
